intro: Pavetta aristata, commonly known as the white pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Pavetta aristata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
